edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class ActiveAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.ActiveAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public abstract class ActiveAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This abstract class represents the active entities of the game. It is used by the Enemy and Player classes. Its purposes are in position settings and movement.
    Author:
    Pink Panthers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      ActiveAgent(int row, int col)

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • rowPosition

        private int rowPosition
        This field represents the position in the row of the object, which will eventually be used for interactions (killing, moving) and for the map. It is in the ActiveAgent(int, int) constructor, setPosition(int, int), and getRow() methods.

      • colPosition

        private int colPosition
        This field represents the position in the column of the object, which will eventually be used for interactions (killing, moving) and for the map. It is in the ActiveAgent(int, int) constructor, setPosition(int, int), and getCol() methods.

      • previousRow

        private int previousRow
        This represents the previous rowPosition of the object. It has two functions: (a) To reset the previous map coordinate to empty (b) As a "breadcrumb" trail for enemies to look for when in Pursuit It is used in the setPosition(int, int), adjustTemps(int, int), and getOldRow() methods.

      • previousCol

        private int previousCol
        This represents the previous colPosition of the object. It has two functions: (a) To reset the previous map coordinate to empty (b) As a "breadcrumb" trail for enemies to look for when in Pursuit It is used in the #setPositions(int, int), adjustTemps(int, int), and getOldCol() methods.

      • possibleRow

        private int possibleRow
        This represents the possible future rowPosition of the object. It is meant to help determine if it will be okay to be placed there, in isChangeInRange(). It is set during setPossibleRC(int, int) and adjustTemps(int, int). It can be retrieved by getPossibleRow().

      • possibleCol

        private int possibleCol
        This represents the possible future colPosition of the object. It is meant to help determine if it will be okay to be placed there, in isChangeInRange(). It is set during setPossibleRC(int, int) and adjustTemps(int, int). It can be retrieved by getPossibleCol().

      • isChangeInRange

        private boolean isChangeInRange
        When the value is true, the object can be placed in possibleRow and possibleCol. If the value is false, the object cannot be placed there. It is used to check whether the possible positions are within the grid in the isChangeInRange() method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActiveAgent

        public ActiveAgent(int row,
                   int col)
        This is the constructor, which places the object in the appropriate position according to the passed arguments.
        Parameters:
        row - will be saved as the rowPosition, which is the object's position on the row.
        col - will be saved as the colPosition, which is the object's position on the column.

    • Method Detail

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int row,
                        int col)
        This method sets the position of the objects. First, the rowPosition is saved to the previousRow and the colPosition is saved to the previousCol, which is necessary to empty the old space, and for the player, leave a trail. The passed arguments then replace the old values for the rowPosition and colPosition.
        Parameters:
        row - replaces the rowPosition.
        col - replaces the colPosition.

      • setPossibleRC

        public void setPossibleRC(int row,
                          int col)
        This method sets the possible positions of the object. This is specifically for the Enemy class, to ensure that it doesn't spawn on top of another entity (such as an ally or other).
        Parameters:
        row - is randomly generated and then placed into possibleRow.
        col - is randomly generated and then placed into possibleCol.

      • checkDirection

        public void checkDirection(int input)
        This method takes a given integer input for the direction, and subsequently sends the information to adjustTemps(int, int) to change the "temporary" fields previousRow, previousCol, possibleRow, and possibleCol.
        Parameters:
        input - is the direction in which the object desires to move in. If the input is 1, it tries to move up; if the input is 2, it tries to move right; if the input is 3, left; if 4, down.

      • adjustTemps

        public void adjustTemps(int row,
                        int col)
        This method is passed by the checkDirection(int) method. The arguments for row and col will be 1, 0, or -1, which corresponds to the direction. This method will change the fields previousRow, previousCol, possibleRow, and possibleCol. It also initializes isChangeInRange to true, then verifies the boolean in isChangeInRange().
        Parameters:
        row - refers to the vertical adjustment of the rowPosition.
        col - refers to the horizontal adjustment of the colPosition.

      • isChangeInRange

        public void isChangeInRange()
        This method checks if the possible new coordinates, possibleRow and possibleCol, are within the grid--[0,9) for both. If they are, then it sets isChangeInRange to true; otherwise, it sets isChangeInRange to false.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        This method simply returns the rowPosition of the object. In other words, the position on the row of the grid, the vertical coordinate.
        Returns:
        rowPosition

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        This method simply returns the colPosition of the object. In other words, the position on the column of the grid, the horizontal coordinate.
        Returns:
        colPosition

      • getOldRow

        public int getOldRow()
        This method simply returns the previousRow of the object. In other words, the old position on the row of the grid, the old vertical coordinate. It is used in emptying the spot and also, for the player, in leaving a trail for the enemies to follow.
        Returns:
        previousRow

      • getOldCol

        public int getOldCol()
        This method simply returns the previousCol of the object. In other words, the old position on the column of the grid, the old horizontal coordinate. It is used in emptying the square and also, for the player, in leaving a trail for enemies to follow.
        Returns:
        previousCol

      • getPossibleRow

        public int getPossibleRow()
        This method simply returns the possibleRow of the object. In other words, the potential future position of the row of the grid. It is used in verifying if it's okay to move there according to the Map.
        Returns:
        possibleRow

      • getPossibleCol

        public int getPossibleCol()
        This method simply returns the possibleCol of the object. In other words, the potential future position on the column of the grid. It is used in verifying if it's okay to move there according to the Map.
        Returns:
        possibleCol

      • getIsChangeInRange

        public boolean getIsChangeInRange()
        This method simply returns the isChangeInRange boolean.
        Returns:
        isChangeInRange
